title: 113_hr709
content: The Act is titled the "Upper Mississippi Conservation and River Protection Act of 2013" or the "Upper Mississippi CARP Act". It includes definitions for various terms used in the Act. The Act defines terms such as "alternative technology barrier" which includes various barriers, "Asian carp" which includes specific carp species, "Lock and Dam 1" located in Minneapolis, and "Lock and Dam 2" located upstream of Hastings, Minnesota. Lock and Dam 4 is located on Mississippi River mile 752.8 in Alma, Wisconsin. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of the Army, acting through the Chief of Engineers. Upper St. Anthony Falls Lock and Dam is situated on Mississippi River mile 853.9 in Minneapolis, Minnesota. A feasibility study is being conducted on the temporary closure of Upper St. Anthony Falls Lock. The Secretary is conducting a study on the feasibility of temporarily closing the Upper St. Anthony Falls Lock to manage the threat of Asian carp in Minnesota. The study will assess potential environmental and economic impacts, consult with relevant entities, consider public comments, and submit a report to Congress within 6 months. Feasibility study on using other Asian carp control measures. The Secretary will conduct a study on implementing control measures at Upper St. Anthony Falls Lock and Dam and Lock and Dam 1 to manage the threat of Asian carp in Minnesota. The study will examine options like permanent closure of the lock, modified lock operations, alternative technology barriers, and other control measures. Potential impacts, including environmental and economic effects, will be assessed. Consultation will be carried out during the study. The Secretary will consult with relevant entities and consider public comments while conducting a study on implementing control measures at Upper St. Anthony Falls Lock and Dam and Lock and Dam 1 to manage the threat of Asian carp in Minnesota. A report on the study results will be submitted to Congress within 1 year of the Act's enactment. SEC. 5. CLOSURE OF LOCKS TO PREVENT SPREAD OF ASIAN CARP. The Secretary may close the lock at the Upper St. Anthony Falls Lock and Dam to manage the threat of Asian carp in Minnesota. The lock must be closed if live adult or juvenile Asian carp are captured above specific dams. If an Asian carp meeting the criteria is captured, the Secretary of the Interior makes determinations. The Secretary of the Interior may close the Upper St. Anthony Falls Lock and Dam in response to a petition, with the closure period determined by the Secretary. The petition and written response will be shared with relevant committees and the public electronically. If the Secretary closes the lock, it can be reopened once measures are in place to manage the threat of Asian carp. Emergency lock operations for flood damage mitigation are allowed. The Council on Environmental Quality will include certain rivers in the Asian Carp Control Strategy Framework. Congress believes that Federal agencies should collaborate with State and local partners on Asian carp control research, with priority given to partnerships where the partners contribute to the research costs.
